review_text: "Lack of staffs and poor management for the property. The room looks new but it is not managed properly. AC was broken from the first night. The staff whom I chat with through app was very attentive and friendly, but didn't solve anything or give us another room. They advertise here as ""smart"" hotel, but the way they run is just not smart. It just an excuse to not hire more staffs. Don't be fooled by the fancy words. (like me)"

review_text: "Place is a trash. When we came into the hotel - cigarette smoke was everywhere. Not to mention the room. Neigborhood is not good neither. Ah yes, this apart-hotel offers rooms with kitchen, but trust me - its not usable, so take a hotel for the same price."

review_text: "However, the major downside was that the air conditioning in my room did not work, and this was during a week when temperatures exceeded 30¬∞C. It was incredibly uncomfortable and made it difficult to sleep. To make matters worse, I was not informed about this issue when booking, and upon raising a complaint, the response was kind of lackluster. I was told that some rooms have faulty air conditioning (long-term issue?), including mine, and that they couldn't move me to a different room. Given that I was paying full price and not receiving the service I expected, this was quite disappointing. When I expressed my frustration, the hotel did offer a 10% discount, but this didn‚Äôt alleviate the discomfort much. The lack of transparency and the ethical concerns about not informing guests beforehand leave a bad aftertaste. As a returning guest, I expected better communication and service. Given these issues, I'm not sure I would consider staying here again. EDIT: My initial stay at Numa Berlin had a major drawbacks - due to a non-functioning air conditioning. However, after posting my review, I was pleasantly surprised when Numa reached out to me immediatelly. They apologized and offered a 20% discount extra compensation. This time, I could the genuine regret. They assured me that they are actively working on addressing the issue and improving both their facilities and customer service. Numa¬¥s response was not just a apology, but a clear acknowledgment of the missteps and a commitment to do better. I am confident NUma Drift is taking the necessary steps to improve the service, and I believe they will handle similar situations more transparently in the future. It‚Äôs clear they are learning from this and are committed to providing better service for future guests. Given this, I‚Äôm willing to give them another try in the future, I look forwars to visitong them in this winter again (this time, the heating will work!) :)"
predicted_labels: Temperature and Ventilation, Staff and Customer Service, Value for Money

review_text: "In a two room accommodation, meant for up to 4 people, entrance in the toilet through bedroom, right in front of the bed. Like literally, door to the toilet is less than one step away from bed... Even in a relationship one doesn't really wants to hear or to be heard on the toilet. Besides that ventilation in there is not the best, so the smell stays in bedroom. And a room meant for up to 4 people, so for big familys or group of friends... We end up using a bathroom in the basement, as it was more convenient than one in our room. I can't imagine what the architect was thinking while creating this."
predicted_labels: Room Size and Layout, Temperature and Ventilation,

review_text: "Worst tight car park ever! Numa The Best/Worst design I have come across, this is our 7th stay on this trip, and we could laugh if it wasn‚Äôt so laughable! (Sarcasm) Numa WhatsApp asks if I need help, ask them to call, gave me a number to call them back, weird! Says 5-10 minutes, waited 20 So much for 5 star service! Lady on the phone, Tatjana, doesn‚Äôt listen, threatens to hang up when I am trying to walk her through all the things missing or inadequate! Asks me to go to some storeroom to pick up pot, pan cutting board myself No face towels! No floor mat from Terrace to Living room, not very good, how to maintain perfect cleanliness? Kitchen completely inadequate, warning sign re sensitive smoke alarm , if so then were is the air extraction? Opening the door likely no help if you fry a steak, and wants me to pay 2500 Euro if the fire brigade is coming? Toilet entrance in the kitchen area! Inside no extraction fan! Good luck if you do your business and cook right after, the smell/aroma will make you real hungry? Location of wardrobe in front of entrance door, furthest away from bath & bed? Who designs something like that? Wifi, completely wonky, inconsistent reception! Update, spoken to a young lady sitting in an office just next to the outdoor gym, and while it was not her job, she did manage to get us a new cutting board, larger then the mini we had & a better knife! So thank you for that, exemplary service from one person! üôèüèª"
predicted_labels: Parking and Transport, Staff and Customer Service, Room Size and Layout

review_text: "It could have been such a great stay but they screwed it up completely. The airco didn‚Äôt work, which can happen, and they would check and let us know next day. No reaction and after contacting again no room available anymore because the airco was broken in more rooms. After checking some reviews the airco was broken for days already in almost the whole building. So it was just keeping you on the line and hoping you wouldn‚Äôt react. After mentioning that there are still rooms available on booking, suddenly it was possible again to get another room but a downgrade. We would get 15% reduction. We have to check out the next day and check in again the day after. The next day again no reaction and after contacting around 15h, ONLY POSSIBLE VIA WHATSAPP btw with a super annoying chatbot you have to go through every time, they suddenly realize there is no room available after all. We have to check in the same room again and check out the day after again. Day 3 already and messing with us the whole time. We decide to leave the apartment and we would get the money back. Last but not least, I had to arrange financially everything myself by booking, I can understand in some way, but Booking also couldn‚Äôt reach the company. The day after I get an invoice by Numa for three nights while we only stayed two nights. Then suddenly I had a number to call so I did immediately. Again explaining everything as they didn‚Äôt understand at the beginning and it was an automatic bill I could ignore. They would charge us only two nights for sure. I asked to get a correct bill to verify but never received it. Luckily we got at the end correctly all money back and only two nights were charged with 15% reduction. BUT WHAT AN AMATEURISH APPROACH, SUCH A PITY!"
predicted_labels: Temperature and Ventilation, Check-in/Check-out Issues, Digital and Automation Issues
